intro: Microstylis pubescens, commonly known as the hairy microstylis, is a small, herbaceous plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Poaceae, commonly known as the grass family. The plant is characterized by its fine, hairy leaves and compact growth habit. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Microstylis pubescens is often found in association with other low-growing flora in its native habitat.
